ygData.subject: Bad concepts

From: "Daniel Paul Hightower" <dph_of_rules@...>

Anybody have scenarios that sound good in theory, but don't work in 
reality?

I put 50 druids on ground, surrounded the area with 3-4 tiles high of 
water and then created a pretty good area just so I could take on the 
faeries.  Sounds like a good idea, right?  Wrong.  The damn druids 
basically covered their entire spot with trees and their protective 
spells so much that it slowed the game down.  I might try again with 
druids that have just enough experience to summon faeries, but not do 
anything else besides creating faeries.
